website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for its fast and easy pull, twist, and snap method of engaging, although some may find the disengaging to be a little more work.
pros: Easy to engage and disengage without the need for any tools or adapters
Good quality material, and a solid design
cons: Some found that this required a little more effort to unlock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Lock - Harder to Unlock
customer_reviews.text: This is the first 'wrenchless' arbor I've purchased and glad to see manufacturers are making this process much easier. You just screw it in until the pins line up push the collar to close. I am giving it four stars because it is somewhat difficult to pull the collar back to unlock it. I lubricated it and it still takes way too much effort to unlock. It does help if you wiggle it back and forth as you are pulling, but I feel it should be as smooth in both directions. No problem with functionality though.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Schleis

customer_reviews.title: Ideal arbor for any hole saw > or = to 2".
customer_reviews.text: Other than with small hole saws this arbor is the the best I have used, I have used several of the major brands versions. Smaller hole saws that are < or = 1-1/2" can catch the arbor and push the pins out of the hole saw while you are still drilling! However, other than those sizes this is my favorite arbor! It's like the Milwaukee one thay you just slide in and out but this one dosn't fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: dreneeps

customer_reviews.title: I got an Irwin arbor in a Lenox package...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!!! Not a huge issue for those of us in the field. But, I've purchased Lenox products for years being an electrical journeyman. Lenox is awesome! It was too late to return the item after I had already used it and thought to myself I'm sure glad I bought my lost arbor again, only to look at it and it says IRWIN on the side of it hahahaha! So those snap packages were repacked in my case with an Irwin arbor. But like I said, it gets the job done. I'm sure I'll lose or break this one too.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: A Hole Saw Necessity
customer_reviews.text: We own several hole saws, and swapping the arbor between them was an exercise in frustration and minor injury. Weep no more my bloodied knuckles, the snap back arbor has made hole saw swapping pain and profanity free. This arbor fits all of our Lenox brand hole saws, and our Milwaukee 4-3/8 carbide grit hole saw. I think it might fit an ACE hardware brand hole saw, but I can't get the the standard arbor off of it to try this one.

product_meta.title: LENOX Tools Hole Saw Arbor with 4-1/4-Inch Drill Bit (1779772)
product_meta.description: The LENOX SNAP-BACK Hole Saw Arbor has a quick-change system that is fast and easy to engage and disengage. It helps minimize thread stripping, so it drives off pins, not threads. No tools are needed, helping prevent the hole saw from locking on the arbor. The LENOX hole saw arbor also threads directly into virtually all hole saws, with no adapter needed. Easier plug removal helps save time.

No tools are needed, helping prevent the hole saw from locking on the arbor
LENOX hole saw arbor threads directly into virtually all hole saws; no adapter required
